Package fr.cnrs.iees.uit.indexing

Class RegionIndexingTree<T>

java.lang.Object
fr.cnrs.iees.uit.indexing.AbstractIndexingTree<T,​fr.cnrs.iees.uit.indexing.RegionIndexingNode<T>>
fr.cnrs.iees.uit.indexing.RegionIndexingTree<T>
Type Parameters:
T - type of content to index
All Implemented Interfaces:
IndexingTree<T,​fr.cnrs.iees.uit.indexing.RegionIndexingNode<T>>, Dimensioned, fr.ens.biologie.generic.Sizeable
Direct Known Subclasses:
BoundedRegionIndexingTree, ExpandingRegionIndexingTree
public abstract class RegionIndexingTree<T> extends AbstractIndexingTree<T,​fr.cnrs.iees.uit.indexing.RegionIndexingNode<T>>

Implementation of a region-based k-d tree.

NOTE: This implementation is a re-coding of the QuadTree and Octtree classes written by Paavo Toivanen. Compared to his work, we have:

  • generalised the QuadTree and Octree classes to the n-dimensional case into a single class (this one);
  • rewritten in generic terms using the Point, Box and Sphere classes the spatial tests used to put newcomers into the proper spatial regions;
  • implemented a more efficient subclass for the case where the initial root region size is known.

Among the features inherited from P. Toivanen's work are

  • the possibility to optimise performance by letting the tree re-balance its leaf node item list capacity;
  • the storage of the item location within the node, which is useful for very dynamic trees (e.g. for use in simulation computations).
Author:
Jacques Gignoux - 07-08-2018

  • Method Details

    • setOptimisation

      public void setOptimisation​(boolean o)

      Setting this to true will balance the tree depth and size following P. Tovainen's benchmarking which shows that a relatively general solution exists which enables to keep performance constant when the tree grows. Basically, it adapts the storage capacity of leaf nodes to the tree size so that the average number of searches to find a particular node is kept reasonably low.

      See the benchmarking details there.

      Parameters:
      o - whether optimisation should be enabled (true) or not (false).

    • getNearestItem

      public T getNearestItem​(Point at)
      Description copied from interface: IndexingTree

      Get the item closest to location.

      CAUTION: will pick the first item encountered if two or more items are found exactly at the same distance of the argument.

      Parameters:
      at - the location
      Returns:
      the item closest to this location
